direction.raw_text: : ENFIELD, ARIZONA A brown Pinto pulls out of a parking lot and into rush hour traffic.

direction.raw_text: is driving. She looks younger, but she's twenty- eight. She has a strong face and flashing intelligent eyes. She's wearing a WAITRESS UNIFORM from Friendly's. She's deep in thought. Beth pulls up to stoplight and stops.

direction.raw_text: : A gentle toot of car horn. Beth looks up, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SID, a pleasant looking twenty-four year old, is in a pick- up truck next to her. He smiles and points up toward the traffic light.

direction.raw_text: She looks up toward the traffic light.

direction.raw_text: They're red except for one with a lit green arrow.

direction.raw_text: She pantomimes that she's in the wrong lane and wants to go straight. Sid pantomimes that he'll let her cut in front of him.

direction.raw_text: Beth pulls away in front of the pick-up truck. The HONKING continues. Sid looks back at the honking car, cheerfully waves to it.

direction.raw_text: A tiny well-kept Spanish style home in lower middle class residential section.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's neat and smartly furnished -- discount Swedish modern, framed deco posters, some nice plants. The only problem is it seems a little more like a well-designed waiting room than a home. There's an empty ice bucket, several empty liquor bottles, and a swinging metal ball thingabobby on a chrome and glass coffee table in front of leather sofa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: are curled up together on the sofa, drinks in hand. They're both in their late twenties. Carol's dressed in the casually stylish clothes worn by women who work in shopping mall boutiques. Nick's clothes are frumpled, a knit tie loose around his neck. They've achieved a state of contemplative drunkenness. Carol sips her drink. Nick sips his drink. Carol sips her drink. Nick brings his glass to his lips, hesitates...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol shakes her head in weary disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knocks back her drink. Nick broods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol stares at him. He knocks back his drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pours herself another drink.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (covering her hurt) Thanks for the news...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I haven't known for long. I just decided. (ruminating) What do I need that makes me make these decisions?

direction.raw_text: She stops at an intersection.

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Whatever makes me happy. That's what she says...

direction.raw_text: Sid's smiling from his truck right behind her. He flashes his lights again.

direction.raw_text: Beth looks up in the rearview mirror, amused.

direction.raw_text: Sid turns off, disappearing into the night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surprised to find herself vaguely disappointed, she drives on.

direction.raw_text: It's small, prefab, and tidy. It has a counter with shutters that open onto the living room. Nick is kneeling, going through bottles in a cabinet.

direction.raw_text: Nick stands, with an almost empty bottle of Johnny Walker Red.

direction.raw_text: He pours himself a drink. Carol shuts the cabinet.

direction.raw_text: Nick opens a cabinet under the sink and tosses the empty bottle in the trash. He begins to pace. Carol shuts the cabinet and follows him with her gaze. As Nick speaks, he gestures grandly with his drink, liquor splashing unnoticed over the sides.

direction.raw_text: He stops and slugs back his drink.

dialogue.raw_text: I know what's going to happen.

dialogue.raw_text: (bursting with frustration) The same job, same scenery, same people... I've been in this town for years... Years!!

direction.raw_text: Beth pulls up to a stoplight, her face blank with thought. She's suddenly lit by the flash of headlights going on and off. She looks up and smiles.

direction.raw_text: Sid's pick-up truck is facing her across the intersection. It slowly pulls up beside her and stops. He smiles and gives a little wave of his hand. Without knowing why, she smiles and waves back.

direction.raw_text: She drives away. Sid stares after her.

direction.raw_text: Carol lifts the end metal ball on the thingabobby and releases it, starting the chain reaction. She stares at it clacking back and forth as she speaks.

direction.raw_text: Nick paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol stops the metal ball. She releases two balls, starting a new chain reaction.

direction.raw_text: Nick slumps on the sofa beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick and Carol collapse into laughter. The front door opens.

dialogue.raw_text: How long a drive is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In a car? It's a fuckin' nightmare.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (griping) And there's no radio in Utah. It's all religious programs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey. Think about this. You take a detour and go through Vegas -- you and Beth stop, see a show, have a nice romantic dinner -- play the slots, get the free drinks...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Too much money. The show. The meal. The slots. Then the hotel -- that's another hundred down the toilet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jabbing Nick) No, you skip the hotel. It's night, the highway's empty -- you can make good time. You start speeding. You get stopped in Utah by the cops -- you flunk the breathalizer, they haul you in. The judge is Mormon -- you get fifteen years, you go to prison, but at least your life has taken a direction!

direction.raw_text: Embarrassed, they both smile self-consciously. There's an awkward instant followed by too much cheerfulness.

direction.raw_text: stands in the doorway, awkwardly conscious of having interrupted something.

direction.raw_text: smiles to herself, a trace of sadness in her eyes.

direction.raw_text: He turns and looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles and shakes her head.

direction.raw_text: She pulls away from him and starts walking to the house next door. He falls into step with her.

direction.raw_text: She nods and looks to the lock.

direction.raw_text: Beth looks to Nick. He stares out at the night.

dialogue.raw_text: I'm tired. I'm going to bed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. (in Nick's words) Billings, Montana. City of the future.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah and I read that a while ago -- so the future's probably already there.

dialogue.raw_text: (defensively) It's not like you're leaving anything behind. A good job or something.

dialogue.raw_text: I know. (after a beat) I'm not eight years old. I know I'll make new friends.

dialogue.raw_text: umm... I... It embarrasses me. When you talk about something with Carol that happened before me. She's my best friend. It embarrasses me that you used to live with her.

dialogue.raw_text: And we're moving. She won't be your best friend anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Living with someone isn't such a big deal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anyway... I live with you now.

direction.raw_text: The kitchen is small and a little grimy, its furnishings fatigued. Nick stares at the coffee-maker in disbelief. He's dressed in a dress shirt, untied necktie, and slacks. He's carrying a sportscoat with a Sears' employee name-tag attached.

direction.raw_text: Beth walks into the kitchen, wearing a robe and carrying the paper. Nick points accusingly at the coffee maker as water pours down from around its top.

direction.raw_text: She drops the paper on the kitchen table and gets a mug off the counter.

direction.raw_text: He angrily wraps the cord around the coffee-maker.

direction.raw_text: He jams the blender into the trash.

dialogue.raw_text: (throwing his jacket on a chair) Shit. (agitated) What's wrong with it?

dialogue.raw_text: Shit. (unplugging the coffee maker) I hate this shit! It never kept the coffee hot. And now this.

dialogue.raw_text: (through a mouthful of donut) You got me.

direction.raw_text: -UP - NEWSPAPER The front page of the Phoenix Sun-Times -- the headline reads "Misery Index Soars". Beth's hand comes INTO FRAME and crumples the page.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth stuffs the paper in a glass and wraps the glass in another piece. She's sitting on the floor, surrounded by dishes, newspaper, and cardboard liquor boxes. She adds the wrapped glass to a box. She hears the SOUND of a CAR DOOR SLAMMING, looks up, then returns to her packing. She reaches behind herself into the trash, pulls out the blender, and begins to wrap it. At the SOUND of the FRONT DOOR opening, followed by a curious METALLIC CLUNKING, she stands and hurries through the swinging door to the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The living room is sparsely furnished -- a sofa, a coffee table, a bookcase cluttered with a handful of paperbooks, a couple of boardgames, a dying cactus, etc. A crappy old fifteen inch t.v. on a t.v. tray. WE SEE this for a moment before... A paint-splattered cloth is unfurled FILLING THE SCREEN. It gently floats down, revealing a PAINTER and his shopping cart overloaded with supplies. He's dressed in paint- splattered clothes. A paint-splattered Red Sox cap is pulled low over his eyes, obscuring his face. Beth stares in disbelief. Without seeing her, the painter backs up, his attention focused on spreading the dropcloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The painter looks up from the drop-cloth, ready to deal with this obstacle. He freezes. His face lights up. It's Sid.

direction.raw_text: Beth stares in agitated disbelief. With his untaken extended hand, he pulls a long strip of masking tape from a roll around his wrist, masking one side of the door frame from top to bottom.

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat, harshly) You won't know when I die. You won't be there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (following her, certain) You'd want me there. If I wasn't there it wouldn't matter who was. You'd be alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you feel? Think! You love me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (her words carefully chosen) I care about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have to be with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. (pause) I care about you. But I'm an adult. I can say no.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (w/ controlled anger) That's what makes you an adult?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (unwavering) Yes. (pause) I can say no. (pause) No, I won't do that. No, I won't have that. No, I can't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (needing to hear her say it) You can say no to me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) Have someplace to go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Don't tell me what to do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Beth makes her way to her car. Sid stands in the doorway, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and faces him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth tosses her suitcases in the backseat. She gets into the car and starts the engine. Sid stands, willing her to stop the car. Beth pulls out to the end of the driveway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks up at the rearview mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid is framed in the doorway of her old home, waiting, trusting that she can't leave, that they are destined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes well with tears. Her face sets with resolve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The car pulls out and disappears down the road. Sid stands in the doorway for a long moment. He steps back into the house and shuts the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick is driving, the cheap headdress still perched on his head. Crumpled empty coffee cups are scattered about the front seat. He reaches up and turns the rearview mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick's face stares back at him. It's not a pretty sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick reaches into the back seat, fishes and comes up with his necktie. He slips the still-knotted necktie over his headdress and tightens it around his neck. Nick looks back to the road and suddenly swerves off an exit ramp. The CAMERA LINGERS on the Exit Sign -- "Enfield AZ.".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid silently goes through the motions of pulling the masking tape from around the window sills of the freshly painted room, his face a stony mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick's car screeches to a stop in front of the house. He leaps out of the car and runs toward the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The front door flings open. Nick charges into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid steps through the swinging door into the living room. Nick freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then Nick, remembering the headdress, rips it off his head and furiously tears it apart -- scattering a flurry of plastic feathers. He hurls what's left of it across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick runs out the front door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Shit! (a moment of manners) Excuse me. (exploding) Shiiiiit!! (confrontationally) Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angrily) I got that. Where'd she go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Nick runs out into his lawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CAMERA FOLLOWING he races up to Carol's front door and leans on the doorbell -- a loud tight buzzing. He pounds on the door, then stops, gasping for breath. No one's home. He turns, leaning against the door for support, staring out at tract house neighborhood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly he bolts for his car. Nick yanks his car door open and disappears into it. In a second he emerges with the bottle of scotch. It's empty. He eyes it for a moment then hurls it as far as he can down the street -- it shatters explosively. He races to his front door and stops dead in his tracks at the open doorway.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (running; under his breath) Be at Carol's... be at Carol's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sid has covered the floor and remaining furniture with drop cloths and is applying even strokes to the ceiling with a long handled roller. Nick steps in and stares at Sid and his own nearly empty drop-cloth covered home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick advances on Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're face to face in a stand-off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts the long handled roller right in Nick's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick ponders this logic, Sid's size, and the roller in his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick wanders around the nearly empty room, then, after a beat... ...he pulls a dropcloth off an object in the corner, revealing the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They both stare at the television. The sweep of HEADLIGHTS turning into the driveway cross their faces. They both race to the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (at the top of his lungs) This really bothers me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a moment, with mock politeness) Will you do me a favor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (adamantly) Listen! I don't want to be normal. I don't have to be, I don't! This is my house. You're in my house. And I'm tired of going to my house and finding strangers!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not your house. You're gone. I'm painting --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: for the new people -- whose house it's going to be. (pause) You're gone. They're not here yet. I'm here. (calmly) I guess that makes this my house.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (w/ a stony politeness) Sure. Make yourself at home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointedly) She didn't seem to want it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's foolish. That t.v. is a remarkable thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carol gets out of her car. Nick hurries toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and walks back into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He races after Sid.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No. Do you know where she went?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Carol, exasperated) Who is this guy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (walking past him toward the house) Beth's new boyfriend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sid is painting the ceiling. Nick bursts through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick stares at her -- knowing what she says is true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick stares at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He exhales loudly and holds his head in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick takes a deep breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid ignores him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick throws his arms in the air and storms up to Carol's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol doesn't flinch. He steps back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns on Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares at Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick stares at Sid, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid looks to Carol, then around the drop cloth covered room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick and Sid both look to Carol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid races out the door. Nick tosses a self-satisfied smile at Carol and walks past her to the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Sid) Not really?! What? (w/ "say it ain't so" attitude) Did you fuck her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus! The next day! (bitterly disillusioned) That's the world, huh? They don't even wait a day anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stepping in the doorway) You left her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hurt) No... I didn't leave her for another person, I left her for another place. (pause) Which I think is a little more excusable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well it's none of your fuckin' business!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cause you fucked her? No! That gives you no business in my life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you hadn't gone, I'd be done by now. I'd be home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be glad you have a home, asshole!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was nice to Beth when you treated her like shit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (busting him) Nick. This is me. You didn't come back for Beth's sake -- something just didn't work out like you had planned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (defensively) You see -- you don't know everything about me -- I didn't really have any real plans!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was sweet to her. They were sweet with each other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beth looked young with him. They had a real connection.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat, dryly) And I brought them together?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It seems I'm blessed... in what I do. I do wrong, and it turns out right... that I've done right. So it really doesn't matter what I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (flamboyantly sarcastic) I hope you're very happy together!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (glancing to Carol, pointedly) She is, isn't she? (to Sid) If you two were such the happy couple why the fuck did she leave, Romeo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: After three years with you, she wanted to be alone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was already gone! This is not about me and Beth, there is no me and Beth! This is about you! Why didn't you go with her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (advancing on him) People aren't going to offer you anything! You have to take what you want.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't take another person. They have to give themselves to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (in his face) That's very wise, but not very true. (relentlessly) I sell televisions. People don't know what they want. You have to show them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. He's not alone, he's with us. She's alone. She's out there alone. (after a beat, quietly) Just hoping she's closer to what she wants...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How would I know?! What do I know?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (w/ a sweeping gesture) I know that what I want isn't there. (pointing to his chest) It isn't here. (gesturing wildly) It isn't inside! It isn't outside! (spent) It doesn't exist.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (forcefully) But you want her, and you aren't doing shit about it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There isn't anything he can do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can go after her. (to Sid) Go after her!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't. She... (torn) My life is here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What kind of man won't fuck up his life for the women he loves? Go find her!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He wouldn't know where to look.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (groping) She'd she'd she'd... (triumphant) She'd head for her parents!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She'd head for her parents. Believe me. (pause, then flatly) They're in Florida. That's east.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (businesslike) You start driving east on route forty. Keep going east and around eleven start checking every roadside motel. The budget ones... You do that all night, you'll find her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How do you know she's on the highway?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When you don't know where you're going, you drive on the highway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Carol) Do I have a chance?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat, shaking her head) You've got a chance.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sid's truck engine roars to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid peels out, driving up onto the lawn past Nick and Carol's cars, out onto the street and out of sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol steps into the doorway beside Nick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick looks back into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol follows him into the room. Nick slumps on the sofa, staring at the blank t.v.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (after a beat) Fuck the ceiling. (walking in) Who looks up that often?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and a WOMAN, both slightly portly Mexican-Americans in their late forties, wearing their Sunday best, step over the threshold and kiss. The man is carrying the woman cradled in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The four stare at each other in awkward silence, the woman still cradled in the man's arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man puts her down on her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick and Carol look to each other, at a loss. Nick looks back to the couple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol throws him a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He holds out his hand to shake. After an instant of awkward hesitation they all shake hands with too much enthusiasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They finish the handshakes -- there's an awkward pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He waits, half expecting this statement to be challenged. It isn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all look at the t.v.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's an awkward pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick and Carol lift the t.v.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They move toward the front door, Carol going backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick looks to make eye contact with Carol. He can't. She's looking back over her shoulder for obstacles. He smiles and glances toward the couple. Nick and Carol go out the door, lugging the t.v.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man and woman look at each other. They look around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares out the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks back to him. He's staring at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry. We thought it was going to be empty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you the couple moving out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (improvising) We're your new neighbors. From next door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well. (putting on a good face) It's nice to meet you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cheerfully, while shaking hands) It is... and it's so nice of you to greet us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Actually, we're here for the t.v.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confidently) The people who left here -- our old neighbors -- left us that t.v.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (going to the t.v.) Well, dear... we should carry it home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (whimsically) I wonder where our furniture is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They're lugging the t.v. across to Carol's -- Carol backing up and Nick going forward. They arrive at the front door. Nick takes most of the weight of the t.v., while Carol fumbles with her key into her front door lock with her free hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol gets the door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol backs into the house, leading the way.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to be their new neighbor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was just something to say.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They lug the t.v. toward the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They step into the living room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah? Well, I had a big day. (after a beat) I went to my parent's house. Like you said to. And there was this ancient man, this giant man in the doorway.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Carol leads them to a corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They gingerly put the t.v. down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick slumps down onto the sofa. Carol watches him, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He smiles at the memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick looks to Carol. She stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol sits beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick looks to Carol, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares at Nick. He avoids her stare. She takes his face in her hand and makes him look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nick stares in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She lets go of his face.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And I thought, "It's my father. My how he's aged."
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not at the house. At the house I was stone sober.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was very tall. He was too tall to be my father. He was wearing a long overcoat, and I thought, "it's a trick, he's on my mother's shoulders".
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And then out from behind him came this beautiful young girl... Beth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lost in reverie) And they sang to me. They sang "London Bridge is Falling Down"... (singing softly) "Falling down, falling down.".
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you've been doing... you can't do anymore.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (determined) It's not like you can't do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (urgently) It's that I don't want you to do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring in his eyes) Nick. (emphatic) I don't want you to do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit. (after a beat, wryly) I hate talking to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Through the windshield we see Sid driving slowly, looking out at motel parking lots. Their neon signs reflect in the windshield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gas stations, fast food joints and motels. Sid and his truck pull away from the strip and up onto the on ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sid and his truck pull onto the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Sid's taillights disappear down the barren highway.
direction.name: direction
